Both of these films promise an engaging experience for those seeking gothic themes and excellent storytelling. Enjoy the movies!

The former, a classic psychological thriller from the 50s, stars Frances Bavier and tells the unsettling story of an eight-year-old girl with a dark secret. On the other hand, "Psychic Experiment" is a more modern mystery that explores strange occurrences within a small town. It features Adrienne King and Glenn Morshower. Both movies might intrigue you with their atmospheric plots and thought-provoking themes. Enjoy!

Considering your interest in gothic themes, I'd highly recommend "The Shining" (1977). This classic horror film takes you on a suspenseful journey into an isolated hotel with a sinister presence that influences the father and his psychic son. Stanley Kubrick masterfully directs this chilling tale, featuring iconic performances by Jack Nicholson and Shelley Duvall.

If you're in the mood for something more lighthearted but still within your preferred genre, "Hot Tub Time Machine" (2010) is a fun comedy that combines time travel with a 80s setting, filled with humor and cameos from notable actors such as John Cusack and Crispin Glover.
